name: Skeletal Juggernaut

trait.name: Disassemble
text: If the juggernaut is reduced to 0 hit points, twelve skeletons rise from its remains.

trait.name: Falling Apart
text: If the juggernaut does not have all of its hit points at the start of its turn, it loses 10 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
text: The juggernaut makes two claws attacks.

action.name: Claws
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Avalanche of Bones (Recharge 5-6)
text: The juggernaut collapses into a large heap before quickly reforming. Each creature within 10 feet of the juggernaut must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is also knocked prone.

description:
As seen lumbering across the beaches in Isle of the Abbey, a skeletal juggernaut is an oversized, bipedal assembly of bones that loses a portion of its mass with each step. These skeletal guardians hold together for only a short time before disassembling into a gang of individual undead.
Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 253, Infernal Machine Rebuild
